programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: Back on track after collecting four points from their last two, Palace welcome Fulham to Selhurst. The Cottagers are looking to take the scalp of a second London rival this week. (09.11)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: Five points is the gap for Ipswich to nearest relegation rivals Wolves. Can Kieran McKenna's side upset in-form Crystal Palace away from home at Selhurst Park in the Premier League? (08.03)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: Oliver Glasner's Palace return to Selhurst after picking up a useful point at the Bridge before the break. Here, the Eagles meet Leicester, who also have a point after three played. (14.09)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: Back to winning ways, the champions Manchester City travel to face Oliver Glasner's Palace, who return to Selhurst Park after picking up three points at relegation rivals Ipswich. (07.12)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: Oliver Glasner's Crystal Palace entertain bottom-of-the-table Southampton. In his first game as Saints boss, Croatian coach Ivan Juric saw his side slip to defeat against West Ham. (29.12)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: Grounded on opening weekend at Brentford, Palace look to take flight at home to West Ham. Julen Lopetegui's side also target Premier League lift off following defeat to Villa. (24.08)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: Two winless sides hoping to break their duck come face to face at Goodison Park, as Everton - who claimed their first point last time out - host Oliver Glasner's Crystal Palace. (28.09)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: Goodison and Everton come next for Ruud van Nistelrooy's Leicester. The Toffees claimed a 1-0 away win at Brighton in what was David Moyes' 700th Premier League match as a manager. (01.02)

programme.title: Champions League Final 1993
programme.desc: We revisit the 1993 final between Marseille and AC Milan at Munich's Olympiastadion. The occasion was later overshadowed by one of the biggest scandals in the sport's history.

programme.title: Champions League Final 1994
programme.desc: A look back at the extraordinary 1994 final at the Olympic Stadium in Athens between Fabio Capello's AC Milan and Barcelona, managed by Johan Cruyff and dubbed the 'Dream Team'.

programme.title: Champions League Final 1995
programme.desc: We revisit the 1995 final in Vienna between Louis van Gaal's Ajax and AC Milan. A star-studded Ajax team featured Edwin van der Sar, Ronald and Frank de Boer, and Edgar Davids.

programme.title: Champions League Final 1996
programme.desc: We revisit the 1996 final between Ajax and Juventus in Rome. Juve's talented side included Didier Deschamps, Antonio Conte and Gianluca Vialli - all at the height of their powers.

programme.title: Champions League Final 1997
programme.desc: We revisit the 1996/97 UEFA Champions League final between Borussia Dortmund and Juventus in Munich. Armed with an expensively assembled squad, Juve were overwhelming favourites.

programme.title: Champions League Final 1998
programme.desc: Real Madrid went in search of their seventh European Cup title when they faced Juventus in the 1998 final in Amsterdam. The Serie A winners featured a 25-year-old Zinedine Zidane.

programme.title: Champions League Final 1999
programme.desc: We revisit the extraordinary 1998/99 UEFA Champions League final between Manchester United and Bayern Munich at the Nou Camp. Victory for United would clinch an historic treble.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2000
programme.desc: A look back at the 1999/00 UEFA Champions League final between Real Madrid and Valencia in Paris. Steve McManaman, signed from Liverpool the previous summer, starred for Madrid.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2001
programme.desc: We revisit the dramatic 2000/01 UEFA Champions League final between Bayern Munich and Valencia at the San Siro in Milan. Bayern were chasing their first title in a quarter-century.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2002
programme.desc: The 2001/02 UEFA Champions League final saw a star-studded Real Madrid face Bayer Leverkusen in Glasgow. The match featured arguably the greatest goal in the competition's history.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2003
programme.desc: We revisit the 2002/03 UEFA Champions League final between Juventus and AC Milan at Old Trafford. Paolo Maldini aimed to lift the trophy as captain, just as his father did in 1963.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2004
programme.desc: We revisit the 2003/04 UEFA Champions League final between Monaco and Porto in Gelsenkirchen. Jose Mourinho would leave Porto to take over at Chelsea just days later.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2005
programme.desc: The 2004/05 UEFA Champions League final saw Rafa Benitez's Liverpool take on AC Milan in Istanbul. The match would go down as arguably the greatest European Cup final in history.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2006
programme.desc: The 2005/06 UEFA Champions League final in Paris saw Arsenal face a pre-Lionel Messi Barcelona, then under the command of Frank Rijkaard, and featuring Ronaldinho in his pomp.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2007
programme.desc: We rewind back to the 2006/07 UEFA Champions League final at the Olympic Stadium in Athens as AC Milan looked to avenge their defeat two years previously against the Reds.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2008
programme.desc: A look back at the 2007/08 UEFA Champions League final between Manchester United and Chelsea at Moscow's Luzhniki Stadium, the first all-English final in the competition's history.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2009
programme.desc: A look back at the 2009 UEFA Champions League final between Barcelona and Man Utd in Rome. United were bidding to become the first team to defend the trophy in the modern era.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2010
programme.desc: We revisit the 2010 UEFA Champions League final between Bayern Munich and Inter Milan at the Bernabeu. Jose Mourinho was looking to become the third man to win it with two clubs.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2011
programme.desc: The 2010/11 UEFA Champions League final saw Manchester United come up against Pep Guardiola's Barcelona at Wembley, the scene of United's first European Cup success back in 1968.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2012
programme.desc: We revisit the 2011/12 UEFA Champions League final between Bayern Munich and Chelsea at the Allianz Arena. This was Chelsea's second final, having lost their last in 2008.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2013
programme.desc: We revisit the all-German 2013 UEFA Champions League final between Borussia Dortmund and Bayern Munich at Wembley. Bayern had lost two finals in three years.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2014
programme.desc: The 2013/14 UEFA Champions League final in Lisbon saw Real Madrid go head-to-head with arch-rivals Atletico Madrid. Real aimed to become the first club to win the trophy 10 times.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2015
programme.desc: We revisit the enthralling 2014/15 UEFA Champions League final between Juventus and Barcelona in Berlin. Barcelona were chasing their third Champions League title in six years.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Final 2016
programme.desc: Relive the 2015/16 Champions League final between Real Madrid and Atletico Madrid at the San Siro. Real were chasing an unprecedented 11th triumph.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Final 2017
programme.desc: A look back at the entertaining 2017 UEFA Champions League final between Real Madrid and Juventus in Cardiff. Madrid were looking to become the first team to retain the trophy.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Final 2018
programme.desc: We look back at the eventful 2017/18 UEFA Champions League final between five-time winners Liverpool and Real Madrid, who were hoping to lift their third consecutive title in Kyiv.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Final 2019
programme.desc: Relive all the action from the 2018/19 Champions League final as Tottenham met Liverpool in an all-English UEFA Champions League final in Madrid.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Final 2020
programme.desc: Action from the 2019/20 Champions League final as Paris Saint-Germain and Bayern Munich meet in Lisbon, Portugal. PSG were appearing in their first ever final in this competition.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Final 2021
programme.desc: Manchester City took on Chelsea in an all-English 2020/21 UEFA Champions League final at Estadio do Dragao in Portugal.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Final 2022
programme.desc: Action from the UEFA Champions League final as Liverpool take on Real Madrid at Stade de France in Paris. The Reds are winless in their last five against the Spanish champions.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Final 2023
programme.desc: Action from the 2023 UEFA Champions League Final as Pep Guardiola's Manchester City face Inter Milan at Ataturk Olympic Stadium in Istanbul, Turkey.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Final 2024
programme.desc: The 2024 UEFA Champions League final between Borussia Dortmund and Real Madrid at Wembley Stadium. Could Edin Terzic's Dortmund upset the odds against 14-time winners Madrid?

programme.title: My Strange Arrest

programme.title: My Strange Arrest
programme.desc: Hanging on the Hood: A man hangs on the hood of his car while his ex-girlfriend drives it on the highway. An intoxicated woman flees from airport police on a motorised suitcase. (S1, ep 8)

programme.desc: High Roller: Les hands out his biggest loan ever on a luxurious Rolls Royce. Will this latest gamble pay off or will another shady transaction leave Les's ego in tatters? (S13, ep 2)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Drag Race: When Les puts the kibosh on Seth's outlandish plan to boost business, father and son head to the race track to decide who's boss. (S13, ep 3)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Lights, Camera, Drama!: The Golds gear up to shoot a new commercial for the store which can only mean drama. Will everyone be happy with the final result? (S13, ep 4)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Karen's Big Idea: Karen brings in a Feng Shui expert in the hope of boosting sales and gaining a positive energy. But Ashley and Seth have some serious doubts. (S13, ep 5)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Estate Sale: Ashley and Les head off to a huge estate sale, Seth takes a custom Corvette go-kart for a spin and Karen eyes up a piece of `70s movie memorabilia. (S13, ep 6)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Animal Instincts: A bidding war hands Ton and Allen a Winchester Model 1912 and a hunter's collection of big game, full-body taxidermy. (S2, ep 10)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Fire in the Hole: Ton and Allen have a blast when they strike gold with a dynamite detonator box. Plus, a 1890s treasure chest reveals secret compartments. (S2, ep 9)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Top Gun Ton: The guys head to a major auction, where lots include a RC Viper Fanjet aircraft, as well as a 1920s Gundlach Korona expedition camera. (S2, ep 8)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Chi-Town Showdown: Ton and Allen face off against infamous auction hunter Chicago Charles as they bid on a Victorian-era burial casket and a hazard from the 1870s. (S2, ep 7)

programme.desc: Henry Cole and restorers Allen Millyard and Guy Willison visit autojumbles in Stratford-upon-Avon and Enfield. (S2, ep 1)

programme.desc: Henry Cole chances his arm at a high class auction of vintage petroliana. (S2, ep 2)

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: UFO Surveillance: The team investigates videos indicating a strong UFO surveillance presence at weapons laboratories. (S3, ep 13)

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Giant Triangles: The team uncovers rare footage of floating giant triangles hovering over cities. Could these strange sightings be extraterrestrial in origin? (S3, ep 1)

programme.title: Evidence Of The Unexplained
programme.desc: Thousands of UFO sightings and abductions are reported every year. This series examines these accounts and casts new light on historic cases. (S1, ep 6)

programme.title: UFOs: The Lost Evidence
programme.desc: Pilots & Astronauts: When it comes to identifying mysterious objects in our skies, few people are more qualified than pilots and astronauts - but are sightings common? (S1, ep 3)

programme.desc: Strange Technology: There are many puzzling artefacts from around the world, challenging everything known about the technological capabilities of distant ancestors. (S4, ep 6)

programme.title: The UnXplained...
programme.desc: The Time Travelers: Explore whether time travel has already occurred - deliberately or by accident - and meet the scientists who believe it is theoretically possible. (S4, ep 1)

programme.title: The UnXplained...
programme.desc: Secrets of Ancient Structures: Age-old ruins can stand with their true history seemingly erased by time - can modern research discover why these ancient structures were built? (S4, ep 2)

programme.title: The UnXplained...
programme.desc: Mysteries of the Vikings: The Vikings were infamous for being bloodthirsty, seafaring warriors - but historians are learning surprising new things about this Norse society. (S4, ep 3)

programme.title: The UnXplained...
programme.desc: Strange Stories of the Presidents: Join William Shatner as he explores the bizarre tales involving US presidents that defy explanation and are still shrouded in mystery. (S4, ep 4)

programme.title: Cities Of The Underworld

programme.desc: Gordon Returns 1: Gordon revisits three restaurants - Handlebar, Casa Roma and The Black Pearl - to check in with the owners he helped. Has his advice been put to good use?

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: House Mouses: Peralta insults Hitchcock and Scully's work ethic, so they try to get involved in a dangerous investigation in an attempt to prove themselves.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Adrian Pimento: The precinct gets a new detective who's coming away from a 12-year undercover assignment with the Mob. Gina directs a video for Captain Holt.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Donny is determined to find Bobby and, with time ticking, Mercedes seeks help. Elsewhere, an unlikely romance blossoms. And does one resident have a dark ulterior motive?

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: As Vicky turns to drink, a loose-lipped confession sends shockwaves. Clare's sinister agenda starts to surface. And will Dillon's test results bring closure or more chaos for him and Lucas?

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: A short, cheeky clip from Rude Tube's naughty little sister, Rude(ish) Tube, featuring sports of the lawnmower, motorbike and bicycle variety.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Spanish Pavillion: Gordon Ramsay visits Spanish Pavillion, a family-run restaurant whose owners, brothers Michael and Jerry, spend more time struggling for power than working.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Classic American: Best pals Colleen and Naomi bought Classic American in New York together, but their inexperience is pushing their friendship to the edge. Can Gordon help?

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Little Big Mom: When Marge breaks her leg in a skiing accident, Lisa takes over running the Simpson household, and Homer and Bart end up moving to a leper colony in Hawaii.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Faith Off: Homer gets a bucket of superglue stuck to his head and the only person who can remove it is a preacher (Don Cheadle), who inspires Bart to become a faith healer.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Free Scratcher and Feminine Wiles: When a new scientist joins the lab, Sheldon is the odd man out. And Mary is given a lotto ticket.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Lobster, an Armadillo and a Way Bigger Number: Sheldon joins Dr Linkletter and Dr Sturgis on a science road trip, which lands them in the middle of nowhere.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Day Alex Left for College: Phil and Claire feel snubbed when Alex gives them the wrong college move-in date to avoid them making it a big deal.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Closet Case: Phil helps Haley convince Claire to allow Dylan to move in temporarily, but when he sees how intimate living together means, he has second thoughts.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: And One to Grow On: Phil tricks Luke into taking a dance class, but the joke's on him when the white lie indirectly lands him in the slammer.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Spock Resonance: While he's being interviewed for a documentary about Star Trek character Mr Spock, Sheldon can't suppress his emotions about his split from Amy.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Mystery Date Observation: While Amy's out on a date with a mystery man, Sheldon enlists Howard and Raj to help him find a new girlfriend online.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Platonic Permutation: At Thanksgiving, Sheldon and Amy hang out as friends at the aquarium, and Howard reluctantly agrees to volunteer at a soup kitchen.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Future Worf and the Margarita of the South Pacific: Sheldon and Missy try to help the family's finances. Mary struggles to find her footing without the church.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Passion's Harvest and a Sheldocracy: Sheldon must choose sides in an ethical dilemma; Mary tries her hand at writing; Mandy needs a new place to live.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Clean for a Day: Before Claire officially takes over Jay's business, she decides she must get the house in order and make the family clean out the clutter.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Thunk in the Trunk: With Claire's business up and running, Phil's got a new role doing all the housework. But he feels invisible, ignored and under-appreciated...

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Last Tap Dance in Springfield: Lisa takes up dancing but discovers that she's not very good at it. Bart and Milhouse duck out of their camping trip and hide out in the mall.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad Marge: Otto's rock 'n' roll marriage to his girlfriend Becky (Parker Posey) is over as soon as it's begun. So Becky moves in with the Simpsons.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Fermentation Bifurcation: The gang run into Penny's ex-boyfriend, Zack, at a wine bar. Bernadette, who can't drink, hangs out with Sheldon.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Line Substitution Solution: Sheldon pays Stuart to spend the afternoon shopping with Amy so that he can queue up to see a special film screening instead.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Convergence Convergence: Conflict arises when Leonard's recently divorced parents and Sheldon's devoutly religious mother are all in town at the same time.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Spy Who Learned Me: While he's on sick leave, Homer learns how to be a better husband, with the help of dashing spy movie crime fighter Stradivarius Cain (Bryan Cranston).

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Dillon spirals, and Lucas is devastated by a shocking betrayal. Donny questions whether Rex is the real culprit. And two guilty villagers make a pact, but can they keep their sordid secret?

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Haw-Haw Land: Nelson goes all-out to impress Lisa when she falls for the talented new boy at school. And Bart takes up chemistry - but to what end?

programme.title: New: Below Deck Mediterranean
programme.desc: Brand new series - This Boat's Not Big Enough for the Stew of Us: Captain Sandy raises safety concerns with her bosun and also has to intervene in a heated argument.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Britain's sharpest armchair critics watch The Masked Dancer, Married at First Sight UK, Nadiya's Everyday Baking, Bad Sisters and This Is MY House.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The Goggleboxers watch the Queen's funeral, The Masked Dancer, Frozen Planet II, Bad Sisters, The Grand Tour: A Scandi Flick and Secret Crush.

programme.title: The Equalizer 2
programme.desc: (2018) Action crime thriller sequel. Denzel Washington returns as Robert McCall who's looking for revenge after ruthless killers murder an agency contact who he also considered a friend.

programme.title: Taken
programme.desc: (2008) Action thriller. Liam Neeson stars as a former CIA operative who vows to track down his daughter after she's kidnapped in Paris.

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: (2020) Menacing horror. When a woman is abducted by the driver of a black jeep, she manages to escape his cabin in the woods. But this guy just won't let it lie and the chase is on.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Great Escape
programme.desc: (1963) Classic - no, wait - iconic World War II movie starring Steve McQueen, James Garner and Richard Attenborough. Allied soldiers plan a daring escape from a German prisoner of war camp.

programme.title: The Perfect Catch
programme.desc: (2005) Comedy. Ben (Jimmy Fallon) must choose between his two loves: Lindsey (Drew Barrymore) and the Boston Red Sox baseball team. Based on Nick Hornby's novel Fever Pitch.

programme.title: Enemy Mine
programme.desc: (1985) Sci-fi adventure starring Dennis Quaid and Louis Gossett Jr. A human and his alien enemy find themselves stranded alone on a hostile planet, where they must work together to survive.

programme.title: Jumanji: The Next Level
programme.desc: (2019) Adventure comedy sequel with Dwayne Johnson, Jack Black, Kevin Hart and Karen Gillan. The old school pals enter the Jumanji video game again to save their friend.

programme.title: Boston Strangler
programme.desc: (2023) Keira Knightley stars as Loretta McLaughlin, the reporter who fought 60s chauvinism to break the story of the notorious titular serial killer, in Matt Ruskin's true crime procedural.

programme.title: Jojo Rabbit
programme.desc: (2019) Oscar-winning comedy-drama from the mind of Taika Waititi, about a young boy in crumbling Nazi Germany who has an imaginary friend called Adolf Hitler. With Scarlett Johansson.

programme.title: P'tang, Yang, Kipperbang
programme.desc: (1982) John Albasiny stars in Michael Apted's comedy as a girl-obsessed 14-year-old who wants England to win the Ashes almost as much as he wants to kiss classmate Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: LumoTV: Echoes of the Past
programme.desc: A deaf family search their family history using a deaf genealogist in the hope of uncovering a further deaf generation.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Nothing But the Best
programme.desc: (1964) Classic British dark comedy with Alan Bates and Denholm Elliott. An ambitious estate agent's clerk hires a toff to teach him to be posh. Couldn't possibly lead to murder, could it?

programme.title: Mandy
programme.desc: (1952) Poignant Ealing drama starring seven-year-old Mandy Miller as a deaf girl whose parents - played by Phyllis Calvert and Terence Morgan - fight over her treatment.

programme.title: The Frogmen
programme.desc: (1951) Second World War thriller. Richard Widmark, Dana Andrews and Robert Wagner star as divers with a special underwater demolition team taking the war to the Japanese in the Pacific.

programme.title: The Swimmer
programme.desc: (1968) Burt Lancaster stars as the angst-ridden middle-aged man who decides to swim home via neighbour's pools in Frank and Eleanor Perry's superb allegorical drama.

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary...
programme.desc: ...Gentlemen: (2003) Fantasy with Sean Connery. In an alternative Victorian age, can Allan Quatermain, Dorian Gray, Captain Nemo, Mina Harker and the Invisible Man avert a war?

programme.title: Bullet Train
programme.desc: (2022) Leaving from Platform 4 - a high octane, Shinkansen-set comedy thriller with Brad Pitt, Joey King and Michael Shannon. A jaded assassin does one last job on a villain-packed train.

programme.title: Terminator Genisys
programme.desc: (2015) Sci-fi thriller with Arnold Schwarzenegger and Emilia Clarke. Part five of the franchise follows Sarah Connor in an alternate timeline to the previous movies, as she takes on Skynet.

programme.title: Berberian Sound Studio
programme.desc: (2012) Psychodrama with Toby Jones. An Englishman is hired to create sound effects for a horror film studio in 1970s Rome. But the job takes a heavy toll on him...

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Destroyer
programme.desc: (1943) Second World War drama about a warship assigned to mail runs but that ends up engaged in battle anyway, starring Edward G Robinson, Glenn Ford and Marguerite Chapman.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: (1954) Crime-comedy starring Alec Guinness. A priest is tasked with accompanying a priceless religious artifact from London to Rome. But the prolific thief Flambeau is hot on his trail...

programme.title: All the King's Men
programme.desc: (1949) Drama with John Ireland. A local politician begins to lust for the kind of power he used to hold to account. He should be careful how he treats people on the way to the top...

programme.title: The Black Swan
programme.desc: (1942) Swashbuckling adventure with Laird Cregar and Tyrone Power. Privateer Captain Henry Morgan tries to rid the Caribbean of pirates when he's made Governor of Jamaica. Bit rich.

programme.title: Charlie's Angels
programme.desc: (2019) Action comedy with Kristen Stewart, Naomi Scott and Ella Balinska. When an engineer blows the whistle on a deadly device, the Angels put their lives on the line to save the planet.

programme.title: Mrs Harris Goes to Paris
programme.desc: (2022) Lesley Manville stars as a cleaner who saves up and heads to Paris to get herself a Dior couture dress, in director Anthony Fabian's fabulous, Oscar-nominated period comedy drama.

programme.title: The Quiet Girl
programme.desc: (2022) Colm Bairad's poignant drama about a little girl who's sent away from home to live with distant family in rural Ireland. Based on Claire Keegan's novella Foster. In Gaelic/subs.

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary...
programme.desc: ...Gentlemen: (2003) Fantasy with Sean Connery. In an alternative Victorian age, can Allan Quatermain, Dorian Gray, Captain Nemo, Mina Harker and the Invisible Man avert a war?

programme.title: Bullet Train
programme.desc: (2022) Leaving from Platform 4 - a high octane, Shinkansen-set comedy thriller with Brad Pitt, Joey King and Michael Shannon. A jaded assassin does one last job on a villain-packed train.

programme.title: Terminator Genisys
programme.desc: (2015) Sci-fi thriller with Arnold Schwarzenegger and Emilia Clarke. Part five of the franchise follows Sarah Connor in an alternate timeline to the previous movies, as she takes on Skynet.

programme.title: Berberian Sound Studio
programme.desc: (2012) Psychodrama with Toby Jones. An Englishman is hired to create sound effects for a horror film studio in 1970s Rome. But the job takes a heavy toll on him...

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Destroyer
programme.desc: (1943) Second World War drama about a warship assigned to mail runs but that ends up engaged in battle anyway, starring Edward G Robinson, Glenn Ford and Marguerite Chapman.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: (1954) Crime-comedy starring Alec Guinness. A priest is tasked with accompanying a priceless religious artifact from London to Rome. But the prolific thief Flambeau is hot on his trail...

programme.title: All the King's Men
programme.desc: (1949) Drama with John Ireland. A local politician begins to lust for the kind of power he used to hold to account. He should be careful how he treats people on the way to the top...

programme.title: The Black Swan
programme.desc: (1942) Swashbuckling adventure with Laird Cregar and Tyrone Power. Privateer Captain Henry Morgan tries to rid the Caribbean of pirates when he's made Governor of Jamaica. Bit rich.

programme.title: Charlie's Angels
programme.desc: (2019) Action comedy with Kristen Stewart, Naomi Scott and Ella Balinska. When an engineer blows the whistle on a deadly device, the Angels put their lives on the line to save the planet.

programme.title: Mrs Harris Goes to Paris
programme.desc: (2022) Lesley Manville stars as a cleaner who saves up and heads to Paris to get herself a Dior couture dress, in director Anthony Fabian's fabulous, Oscar-nominated period comedy drama.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: Lively debate and discussion with our panel of paper reviewers about the stories making tomorrow morning's newspapers.

programme.title: Noel Edmonds' Kiwi Adventure
programme.desc: After 50 years in the spotlight, Noel Edmonds left his TV career behind and started a new life in New Zealand with his wife Liz in 2018. They bought land in the quiet town of Ngatimoti, where they have been building a hospitality business. This series follows the couple's journey as they battle the challenges of small-town life and try to turn their vision into a success while navigating the pressure of being seen as outsiders

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Gary Barlow's Food and Wine Tour: Australia
programme.desc: Gary is joined by fellow boyband superstar Ronan Keating in an exploration of Australia's red centre. Starting in Alice Springs, Gary and Ronan visit a local brewery to help out behind the scenes before learning to cook an Australian bush staple over a fire, get lessons in astronomy and the didgeridoo, and visit the sacred site of Uluru

programme.title: Jeremy Pang's Hong Kong Kitchen
programme.desc: Jeremy is joined by good friend and fellow chef Nisha Katona at Bar Leone, a place where world-class cocktails and appetisers set the tone. Knowing Nisha's love for authentic street food, Jeremy takes her deep into Hong Kong's local food scene for the ultimate clay pot rice, and then ups the ante with a visit to Arcane, a modern European Michelin-starred gem in the heart of the city

programme.title: Addams Family Values
programme.desc: Comedy horror starring Anjelica Huston and Raul Julia. The arrival of baby Pubert leads to some "deadly" games in the Addams household as the jealous Wednesday and Pugsley try to dispose of their new sibling. Morticia and Gomez hire Debbie as a nanny for the new arrival, and Debbie soon attracts the amorous attentions of Uncle Fester. But the nanny's motives prove to be even more sinister than the Addams clan itself.

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by comedian Babatunde Aleshe, while Lucy Pateman teaches the host and Aldo Zilli about tablescaping, and hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform the look of a charity ambassador

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan chats to film and theatre star Tom Courtenay, and actor Colin Salmon, who relives his career from his first TV role with Helen Mirren to his latest in EastEnders. Also in this episode, a meeting with two biscuit-loving rescue donkeys, Camilla Bassett-Smith opens her April diary and gives a clematis its television debut, stone carver Zoe Wilson reveals the beauty of Welsh slate, and Lesley Joseph is all at sea with the first of her Coastal Chronicles

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Jason Williams heads to the Malvern Spring Festival for a behind-the-scenes look at this year's stand-out gardens, while Alan shares the latest seasonal highlights from his own plot. Camilla Bassett-Smith travels to the Scottish hills to explore a beautifully preserved Japanese garden with a rich family history, Martha Swales offers a step-by-step guide to creating a wildlife pond, and Helen Cross shares practical ways to get children into gardening

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Members of the public compete alongside celebrities including Jake Quickenden, Dom Lever, Katie Walsh and Lee Latchford-Evans. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK

programme.title: Live and Let Die
programme.desc: Spy adventure that marks Roger Moore's debut as James Bond. Investigating the deaths of three British agents, Bond finds himself up against the mysterious "Mr Big", a New York drug baron with plans for world domination. The trail leads to New Orleans and the Caribbean, where Bond discovers a sinister voodoo cult and the beautiful tarot-card reader Solitaire.

programme.title: Live Women's International Football
programme.desc: England v Jamaica (Kick-off 5.00pm). Laura Woods presents all the action from the friendly at King Power Stadium in Leicester. This is England's final match before they get their UEFA Euro 2025 campaign under way as reigning champions when they take on France on 5 July. They face a potentially tough test in their first ever meeting with the Jamaicans, who reached the last 16 of the 2023 FIFA World Cup. With analysis from Karen Carney and Anita Asante, and commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Joel Kingston is a copper's copper from a respected and notable police family, but when he is found dead, floating in a park lake, DCI Vera Stanhope investigates both sides of the thin blue line in order to find his killer. A complex family dynamic, tensions at work, and brushes with the underworld, paint a dark and complex picture. Joel was there to serve and protect but did his stubborn commitment to justice at any price lead to his death? Murder mystery, starring Brenda Blethyn and Kenny Doughty

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: When a helpless baby boy was found in Milton Keynes in 1984, staff at a nearby hospital named him after the royal baby born just a few weeks earlier. 'Harry' was adopted and raised as Jon, but he is still haunted by the mystery of his start in life, and so is foundling Tina, who was left outside a hospital in Stoke-on-Trent in 1970. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell help the duo find out more about their respective families

programme.title: Noel Edmonds' Kiwi Adventure
programme.desc: A bout of bad weather is putting increasing pressure on the viability of Noel and Liz's River Haven business as numbers are down due to the rain, and their boutique vineyard is in danger of severe frost damage. As the weather improves, Noel is determined to turn things round. Could raft tours and New Zealand's first energy garden help their business survive?

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents action from the Brands Hatch Indy circuit featuring racing from the Porsche Sprint Challenge Great Britain and the Caterham Seven Championship UK.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Jeremy Pang's Hong Kong Kitchen
programme.desc: Jeremy is joined by TV presenter Chris Bavin, starting in the city's outskirts by diving into the world of regenerative farming, before doing a spot of line fishing. The real catch of the day, however, might be a tour of Hong Kong's last traditional roasting pits for Chris

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Brian Conley, Sue Perkins and Colin Salmon to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Gerard and Maxine from Doncaster, Sam and Ellie from Newbury, and Chris and her daughter Sally from Hull use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Adil Ray hosts

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Nick from Liverpool, Laura from Bolton, Aiden from Falkirk and Vivienne from Bracknell pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Paddy is attacked, Ross attempts to get Lewis to change his mind, and Mack plays a dangerous game

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Todd offers Millie a way out of her lie, Kevin realises that something is going on between Carl and Abi, Dee-Dee defies James by enquiring about a christening for Laila, and Cassie wins over Sally and Tim

programme.title: Shardlake
programme.desc: Cromwell is furious with Shardlake's lack of results and Henry VIII's right-hand man gives the lawyer a terrifying ultimatum. Shocked after uncovering the history behind the murder weapon and the true owner of the sword, Shardlake faces a stark choice at the end of his investigation

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: TikTok: Murder Gone Viral
programme.desc: After surviving an attempt on her life, TikTok star Sania Khan went viral campaigning for South Asian women's rights. Little did she realise this would put her in mortal danger from her ex-husband.

programme.title: British Touring Car Championship Highlights
programme.desc: Steve Rider presents action from the fifth round of the season at Oulton Park, where the 13th, 14th and 15th races of the season took place. The title race is heating up at the halfway point of the season after Tom Ingram's first win of the campaign at Thruxton cut Ash Sutton's championship lead down to nine points. With commentary by from David Addison, analysis from Tim Harvey, Paul O'Neill and Jade Edwards, and reports by Louise Goodman

programme.title: Suspicion
programme.desc: Vanessa and Scott work together to interrogate the suspects. A mysterious figure leaves a path of destruction in his wake.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Dermot O'Leary's Taste of Ireland
programme.desc: Dermot travels to the gourmet capital of Ireland, Kinsale, where he learns about the quintessential ingredient seaweed before taking a chocolate making masterclass. He's then goes foraging for wild garlic before putting together a dish inspired by his travels with a Michelin starred chef

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu
programme.desc: James makes a crme brle for chocolatier Mark Tilling, enjoys a dish of cod from chef John Hooker and whips up a beef pie for singer Tony Hadley

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Hemel Hempstead husband and wife Hari and Rasika, Merseyside couple Kellie and Eric, and Northern Irish father and son Tony and Laurence use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Adil Ray hosts

programme.title: Emmerdale

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A local outcast who was controversially acquitted of murder years previously is the latest inductee into a post-operative heart rehab club. However following his arrival, some of the members' dreams of a second chance at life begin being cut short. Guest starring Keith Allen and John Thomson

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Casino Royale
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Daniel Craig in his first appearance as 007. James Bond is awarded his licence to kill and sets off in pursuit of Le Chiffre, a corrupt banker who finances terrorism. Realising that the desperate Le Chiffre needs to win big on the gaming tables of Montenegro to pay off a dangerous client, Bond formulates a plan to ruin him in a high-stakes poker game.

programme.desc: James makes a crme brle for chocolatier Mark Tilling, enjoys a dish of cod from chef John Hooker and whips up a beef pie for singer Tony Hadley

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Hemel Hempstead husband and wife Hari and Rasika, Merseyside couple Kellie and Eric, and Northern Irish father and son Tony and Laurence use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Adil Ray hosts

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants David, Samantha, Tom and Danae pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Paddy has a disastrous encounter, Lewis is unable to believe his brother has betrayed him, and Sarah helps Cain

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A local outcast who was controversially acquitted of murder years previously is the latest inductee into a post-operative heart rehab club. However following his arrival, some of the members' dreams of a second chance at life begin being cut short. Guest starring Keith Allen and John Thomson

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Casino Royale
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Daniel Craig in his first appearance as 007. James Bond is awarded his licence to kill and sets off in pursuit of Le Chiffre, a corrupt banker who finances terrorism. Realising that the desperate Le Chiffre needs to win big on the gaming tables of Montenegro to pay off a dangerous client, Bond formulates a plan to ruin him in a high-stakes poker game.

programme.title: Noel Edmonds' Kiwi Adventure
programme.desc: After 50 years in the spotlight, Noel Edmonds left his TV career behind and started a new life in New Zealand with his wife Liz in 2018. They bought land in the quiet town of Ngatimoti, where they have been building a hospitality business. This series follows the couple's journey as they battle the challenges of small-town life and try to turn their vision into a success while navigating the pressure of being seen as outsiders

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Gary Barlow's Food and Wine Tour: Australia
programme.desc: Gary is joined by fellow boyband superstar Ronan Keating in an exploration of Australia's red centre. Starting in Alice Springs, Gary and Ronan visit a local brewery to help out behind the scenes before learning to cook an Australian bush staple over a fire, get lessons in astronomy and the didgeridoo, and visit the sacred site of Uluru

programme.title: Jeremy Pang's Hong Kong Kitchen
programme.desc: Jeremy is joined by good friend and fellow chef Nisha Katona at Bar Leone, a place where world-class cocktails and appetisers set the tone. Knowing Nisha's love for authentic street food, Jeremy takes her deep into Hong Kong's local food scene for the ultimate clay pot rice, and then ups the ante with a visit to Arcane, a modern European Michelin-starred gem in the heart of the city

programme.title: Addams Family Values
programme.desc: Comedy horror starring Anjelica Huston and Raul Julia. The arrival of baby Pubert leads to some "deadly" games in the Addams household as the jealous Wednesday and Pugsley try to dispose of their new sibling. Morticia and Gomez hire Debbie as a nanny for the new arrival, and Debbie soon attracts the amorous attentions of Uncle Fester. But the nanny's motives prove to be even more sinister than the Addams clan itself.

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by comedian Babatunde Aleshe, while Lucy Pateman teaches the host and Aldo Zilli about tablescaping, and hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform the look of a charity ambassador

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan chats to film and theatre star Tom Courtenay, and actor Colin Salmon, who relives his career from his first TV role with Helen Mirren to his latest in EastEnders. Also in this episode, a meeting with two biscuit-loving rescue donkeys, Camilla Bassett-Smith opens her April diary and gives a clematis its television debut, stone carver Zoe Wilson reveals the beauty of Welsh slate, and Lesley Joseph is all at sea with the first of her Coastal Chronicles

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Jason Williams heads to the Malvern Spring Festival for a behind-the-scenes look at this year's stand-out gardens, while Alan shares the latest seasonal highlights from his own plot. Camilla Bassett-Smith travels to the Scottish hills to explore a beautifully preserved Japanese garden with a rich family history, Martha Swales offers a step-by-step guide to creating a wildlife pond, and Helen Cross shares practical ways to get children into gardening

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Members of the public compete alongside celebrities including Jake Quickenden, Dom Lever, Katie Walsh and Lee Latchford-Evans. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK

programme.title: Live and Let Die
programme.desc: Spy adventure that marks Roger Moore's debut as James Bond. Investigating the deaths of three British agents, Bond finds himself up against the mysterious "Mr Big", a New York drug baron with plans for world domination. The trail leads to New Orleans and the Caribbean, where Bond discovers a sinister voodoo cult and the beautiful tarot-card reader Solitaire.

programme.title: Live Women's International Football
programme.desc: England v Jamaica (Kick-off 5.00pm). Laura Woods presents all the action from the friendly at King Power Stadium in Leicester. This is England's final match before they get their UEFA Euro 2025 campaign under way as reigning champions when they take on France on 5 July. They face a potentially tough test in their first ever meeting with the Jamaicans, who reached the last 16 of the 2023 FIFA World Cup. With analysis from Karen Carney and Anita Asante, and commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Joel Kingston is a copper's copper from a respected and notable police family, but when he is found dead, floating in a park lake, DCI Vera Stanhope investigates both sides of the thin blue line in order to find his killer. A complex family dynamic, tensions at work, and brushes with the underworld, paint a dark and complex picture. Joel was there to serve and protect but did his stubborn commitment to justice at any price lead to his death? Murder mystery, starring Brenda Blethyn and Kenny Doughty

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: When a helpless baby boy was found in Milton Keynes in 1984, staff at a nearby hospital named him after the royal baby born just a few weeks earlier. 'Harry' was adopted and raised as Jon, but he is still haunted by the mystery of his start in life, and so is foundling Tina, who was left outside a hospital in Stoke-on-Trent in 1970. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell help the duo find out more about their respective families

programme.title: Noel Edmonds' Kiwi Adventure
programme.desc: A bout of bad weather is putting increasing pressure on the viability of Noel and Liz's River Haven business as numbers are down due to the rain, and their boutique vineyard is in danger of severe frost damage. As the weather improves, Noel is determined to turn things round. Could raft tours and New Zealand's first energy garden help their business survive?

programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents action from the Brands Hatch Indy circuit featuring racing from the Porsche Sprint Challenge Great Britain and the Caterham Seven Championship UK.

programme.title: TikTok: Murder Gone Viral

programme.title: British Touring Car Championship Highlights
programme.desc: Steve Rider presents action from the fifth round of the season at Oulton Park, where the 13th, 14th and 15th races of the season took place. With commentary by from David Addison, analysis from Tim Harvey, Paul O'Neill and Jade Edwards, and reports by Louise Goodman
